definition: (of a fragrance) to waft about/(fig.) (of foods) to become popular in other places as well
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]

sentences.english: Autumn Qing Yang, chrysanthemum fragrance, but also a fall festival.
sentences.chinese: 秋风轻扬，菊花飘香，又是一个秋季节。

sentences.english: Fruit jelly with milk taste is loved By Both young and old.
sentences.chinese: 奶汁飘香的果子冻，老少都喜欢。

sentences.english: For me it's a peppermint mocha latte.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说那就是一杯薄荷飘香摩卡拿铁。

sentences.english: The golden mangos of Red River Valley give off attracting fragrance in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 红河谷的金芒果，阳光下诱人地飘香。

sentences.english: I know you like Clam Chowder, because you like Pina Colada.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你喜欢海鲜蛤蜊汤，因为你喜欢‘椰林飘香’。

sentences.english: Birds were singing, animals were playing, and wild flowers perfumed the air.
sentences.chinese: 那里，小鸟歌唱，动物嬉戏，野花飘香。

sentences.english: Autumn in October, Tan Kwai fragrance and a variety of fruit aroma in the air was filled.
sentences.chinese: 金秋十月，丹桂飘香，各种水果的香味在空气中弥漫。

definition: to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
to penetrate deeply into the heart (idiom)/to gladden the heart/to refresh the mind
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
